p: X-ray showed that L4/5 intervertebral height was obviously collapsed ( Figure 1). Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) implied that there was a lateral type disc protrusion on the right side in L4/5 which was in a condition of Modic II type degeneration, mildly pressing the lumbar 5th nerve on the right Figures 2, 3. Thus, the patient was initially diagnosed as sciatica caused by lumbar disc herniation.
